title: ASL 5.3 ‚Äî Deaf Art & Storytelling üé≠üñºÔ∏è
objectives: Identify features of ASL storytelling and Visual Vernacular (VV): space, rhythm, role-shift
Discuss Deaf art themes (IDENTITY, ACCESS, COMMUNITY, PRIDE) using short clauses
Perform a micro-story using anchors, NMMs, and at least one role-shift

vocab.def: Narrative framing; neutral space with clear pacing.
Highly visual, cinematic signing style; minimal lexical signs.
Fixed points for people/objects reused across clauses.
Timing of movements and NMMs to shape the story.
Common ideas in Deaf art & narratives.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: VV Micro-Moves

media.caption: Cinematic feel: zoom/pan/cut with face & torso

sections.body: Practice 3 VV tools: **ZOOM (eyes/chin lean)**, **PAN (head/eyes sweep)**, **CUT (tiny pause + snap to next pose)**. Keep hands minimal; let the **face/torso** carry the effect.

sections.heading: Model: Art Themes ‚Üí Short Clauses
sections.body:
Examples:
‚Ä¢ **DEAF IDENTITY PROUD.**
‚Ä¢ **ACCESS IMPORTANT COMMUNITY.**
‚Ä¢ **ART SHOW STORY DEAF-LIFE.** Keep each clause 3‚Äì5 signs with a tiny pause.

sections.heading: Anchors + RS: Character Moment
sections.body:
Place **A** (left) and **B** (right). Narrate neutral; use **RS‚ÜíA** for reaction, **RS‚ÜíB** for reply, then return to neutral. Example:
‚Ä¢ **NEUTRAL:** **SHOW START.**
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíA:** **WOW!**
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíB:** **NICE!**

callouts.title: Return to Neutral
callouts.body: After each RS line, pop back to narrator so the audience tracks who speaks.

microCheck.q: After a role-shift, what restores clarity?

sections.heading: Partner Practice: 10-Second VV
sections.body: Create a **10s VV**: one **ZOOM**, one **PAN**, one **CUT**, and **1 RS** line. Theme prompt (choose one): **PRIDE**, **ACCESS**, **COMMUNITY**. Swap roles and coach rhythm.

microCheck.q: Which pairing best improves VV clarity?

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **12‚Äì18s**: state a theme (e.g., **ACCESS**), then perform a micro-story with **2 anchors**, **1 RS**, and **one VV cut**. Example close: **COMMUNITY STRONG.**
sections.teacherNote: Allow privacy submissions; caption should name the theme and where the ‚Äòcut‚Äô occurred.

items.q: Core VV technique for switching shots:
What maintains character clarity during dialogue?
Write a 2-clause gloss with a theme (e.g., PRIDE) and one RS line.

items.prompt: Which VV tool (zoom, pan, cut) felt most natural? How will you practice its timing?

reflectionPrompt: Upload your 12‚Äì18s VV micro-story. Caption the theme and note where your cut happened.
summary: You explored ASL storytelling & VV: used anchors, role-shift, rhythm, and a clear ‚Äòcut‚Äô to deliver a themed micro-story tied to Deaf art and identity.
